snippet: Warner, a former FIFA official who is accused of racketeering, is a polarizing populist in Trinidad and Tobago whose life has come to resemble Shakespearean theater.
abstract: Prime Min Kamla Persad-Bissessar of Trinidad and Tobago publicly lashes out at former premier Jack Warner, polarizing populist who now stands accused of racketeering by United States during his tenure as vice president of FIFA, world soccer's governing body; accuses once close friend Warner of bringing potentially irreparable shame and scandal on the entire nation.

byline.contributor: Laura Dowrich-Phillips contributed reporting from Port of Spain, and William K. Rashbaum from New York.

lead_paragraph: Warner, a former FIFA official who is accused of racketeering, is a polarizing populist in Trinidad and Tobago whose life has come to resemble Shakespearean theater.

headline.main: At Center of FIFA Scandal, a Divisive Politician in Jack Warner
headline.print_headline: At Center of FIFA Scandal, a Divisive Politician

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
